comments.body:
This change is intended to be staged across two releases, but it may make sense to make more of the changes that 'assume source_type is in tags only'. These would include:

- Removing these parameters from the MlflowClient tracking API (e.g., mlflow/projects/__init__.py#create_run would have to embed these in tags instead).
- Mentioning in the protos that these fields are deprecated and moved to tags.
- Changing the JavaScript to read first from the tag and then from the field.
We agreed that a subsequent PR should implement these.

comments.body: Nit: We should probably be using `pytest` here.
Do we use `unittest` because it makes it easier to define `tearDown()` routine to purge the Sql store tables?
Would it be difficult to test that I can delete the default experiment and have it not come back, assuming that I created at least one other experiment?

yes! Was a bit of a pain but wrote a testcase that pins a sqlite file for a test. in the middle of the test, it destroys `SqlAlchemyStore`, and ensures that deleted `Default` experiment stays deleted with new `SqlAlchemyStore` using same sqlite file.

Thanks for the idea...

comments.body:
Btw, could we document what the parameter to `_get_run` is? It seems a bit weird that I ask for a run by id, but also must pass in the state I expect it to be in. Maybe it could default to ViewType.ALL, unless this is a safety thing?

The error message isn't great, btw, if ViewType mismatches -- it would just say `No runs with id <> exists`. Not only is this grammatically incorrect (üòõ), but it doesn't indicate why there was a problem. Having the caller enforce the ViewType constraint where appropriate might be clearer.

That is a good point--I think the motivation was to push down the filter for ACTIVE vs DELETED runs. Maybe the method should return the run and caller should print appropriate message.

Will handle this as a follow on change
